This guide is a simplified overview of all the changes in the [[Halloween Update]] ({{JE}} Alpha v1.2.x releases), which assumes at least some familiarity with the Alpha v1.1.x releases.

== Mobs ==
=== New ===
{|{{Simple Guide table|New Mobs}}
|-
|[[Ghast]]
|[[File:Ghast JE1 BE1.gif|84px]]
|[[The Nether]]
|{{Drop|Item|Gunpowder|0|2}}
|The first flying mob.
|-
|[[Zombie Pigman]]
|[[File:Zombified Piglin JE2.png|84px]]
|The Nether
|{{Drop|Item|Cooked Porkchop|0|2}}
|The first neutral mob.
|}

{|{{Simple Guide table|Changed Mobs}}

|[[Creeper]]
|[[File:Creeper JE3 BE1.png|84px]]

== Blocks ==
=== New ===
{|{{Simple Guide table|New Blocks}}
|-
|[[Netherrack]]
|[[File:Netherrack JE1.png|84px]]
|Found throughout the Nether.
|Any pickaxe
|Burns indefinitely when lit on fire.
|-
|[[Soul Sand]]
|[[File:Soul Sand JE1 BE1.png|84px]]
|Found in patches on the floor of the Nether.
|Any shovel
|Slows down entities that pass over it.
|-
|[[Glowstone]]
|[[File:Glowstone JE1.png|84px]]
|
{{Crafting
|A1=Glowstone Dust

|C3=Glowstone Dust
|Output=Glowstone
}}
* Found in growths on the ceiling of the Nether.
|Any
|Produces light.
|-
|[[Pumpkin]]
|[[File:Carved Pumpkin (S) JE1 BE1.png|84px]]
|Found in patches in the [[Overworld]].
|Any axe
|Can be worn as a hat or crafted into a jack o'lantern.
|-
|[[Jack o'Lantern]]
|[[File:Jack o'Lantern (S) JE1 BE1.png|84px]]
|

}}
|Any axe

|[[Nether Portal (block)|Nether Portal Block]]
|[[File:Nether Portal (EW) JE1.png|84px]]
|Created when the interior of an empty 4×5 frame of [[obsidian]] is lit on fire.
|Any
|Touching this block teleports players between the Overworld and Nether dimensions.
|}

=== Changed ===
{|{{Simple Guide table|Changed Blocks}}
|-
|[[Grass]] and [[Leaves]]
|{{Animate|Grass Block JE3.png;Oak Leaves JE3 BE4.png|84px}}
|Are now darker in color, and change shade based on the biome.
|}

== Items ==
=== New ===
{|{{Simple Guide table|New Items}}
|-
|[[Clock]]
|[[File:Clock JE1.gif|84px]]
|
{{Crafting
|B1=Gold Ingot
|A2=Gold Ingot
|B2=Redstone Dust
|C2=Gold Ingot
|B3=Gold Ingot
|Output=Clock
}}
|Can be used to tell the time.
|-
|[[Glowstone Dust]]
|[[File:Glowstone Dust JE1 BE1.png|84px]]
|Obtained from glowstone blocks. Each block drops one.
|Can be used to craft glowstone blocks, requires nine at the time.
|-
|[[Raw Fish]]
|[[File:Raw Cod JE1 BE1.png|84px]]
|Obtained by [[fishing]].
|Can be cooked into cooked fish, which restores two and a half hearts, the same as [[bread]]. Restores one heart when not cooked, making this the worst food in the game at the time.
|-
|[[Cooked Fish]]
|[[File:Cooked Cod JE1 BE1.png|84px]]
|
{{smelting|Raw Cod|Cooked Cod|0,35}}
|Can be eaten to restore 5 hp.
|}

=== Changed ===
{|{{Simple Guide table|Changed Items}}
|-
|[[Fishing Rod]]
|[[File:Fishing Rod JE1 BE1.png|84px]]
|Can now be used to catch fish.
|}

== Biomes ==
=== New ===
{|{{Simple Guide table|New Biomes}}
|-
|[[The Nether]]
|[[File:Halloween Update Screenshot.png|256px]]
|A cavernous alternate [[dimension]] made up of [[netherrack]], [[soul sand]], [[gravel]] and [[lava]].
|
* Nether portals
* Glowstone clusters
|-
|[[Desert]]
|[[File:Old Desert.jpg|256px]]
|A sandy biome, with cacti.
|[[Cacti]]
|-
|[[Savanna]]
|[[File:Savanna.jpg|256px]]
|A flat grassy biome, many roses, also somewhat high amount of passive mobs.
|
|-
|[[Plains]]
|[[File:Plains.jpg|256px]]
|A flat grassy biome, a haven for passive mobs.
|
|-
|[[Shrubland]]
|[[File:Shrubland.jpg|256px]]
|A grassy biome with a low amount of trees, always the small variant.
|[[Oak tree]]s, many flowers, moderate amount of passive mobs.
|-
|[[Swampland]]
|[[File:Swampland.jpg|256px]]
|A grassy biome with some trees, along with many small water pools.
|Oak trees, and mushrooms occasionally. Not many mobs in general.
|-
|[[Seasonal forest]]
|[[File:SeasonalForest.jpg|256px]]
|A grassy biome covered with slightly less trees than the regular forest.
|Oak trees, and flowers. Roses here seem to be lacking. Leaves have a orangish tint. Lacks many mobs in general.
|-
|[[Forest]]
|[[File:Forest.jpg|256px]]
|A grassy biome covered with trees, some occasional mushrooms.
|Oak trees, fewer flowers, and some sugar cane. Very rarely hostile mobs spawn in the shade. Low amount of passive mobs.
|-
|[[Rainforest]]
|[[File:Rainforest.jpg|256px]]
|A grassy biome covered with many trees, often with many mushrooms in the shade.
|Oak trees, reeds, flowers, and roses. The amount of large trees here mean hostile mobs are prolific at night and even spawn in the day under trees, though this is somewhat uncommon.
|-
|[[Tundra]]
|[[File:Tundra.jpg|256px]]
|A flat snowy biome.
|Vegetation here is lacking, other than the very rare tree and possibly flowers. Chickens spawn here often for some reason.
|-
|[[Taiga]]
|[[File:Biomes Example.png|256px]]
|A snowy biome covered with trees, low amount of hostile mobs and moderate passive mobs.
|Oak trees, flowers (later [[Dandelion]]) and roses. (later [[Poppy]])
|}
